4zmakf7XsS9g5Zt5.description:
The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the Spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of four options.

  • Cook Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
  • Lift Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
  • Make Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile-it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
  • Tidy Color, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. You can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object a 1 minute per Bulk.

Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as you Sustain the Spell.
4zmakf7XsS9g5Zt5.name: Prestidigitation

70O2wq2SL65HRZ1r.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

70O2wq2SL65HRZ1r.name: Daze

B2A1WtHMgeBV8b03.description:
You ask for divine guidance, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3qHKBDF7lrHw8jFK]{Spell Effect: Guidance}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3LyOkV25p7wA181H]{Effect: Guidance Immunity}
B2A1WtHMgeBV8b03.name: Guidance

IPQtB4MILlYeL6gJ.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
IPQtB4MILlYeL6gJ.name: Detect Magic

QdDOLKQtFBTNNqSd.description:
You ward a creature with protective energy that deters enemy attacks. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends.

Critical Success Sanctuary ends.

Success The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.

Failure The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.

Critical Failure The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of sanctuary's duration.
QdDOLKQtFBTNNqSd.name: Sanctuary

TeRIhHiMC7t0lc7H.description:
You channel void energy to harm the living or heal the undead. If the target is a living creature, you deal 1d8 void damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, you restore that amount of Hit Points. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing an undead creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.

3 (material, verbal, somatic) You disperse void energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the area.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
TeRIhHiMC7t0lc7H.name: Harm

XLeogW8smAEquq4w.description:
You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical, and if it is, you learn the school of magic.

If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's level is lower than the rank of your read aura spell.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to 10 objects.

Heightened (6th) You can target any number of objects.
XLeogW8smAEquq4w.name: Read Aura

Reast can use this reaction once per day.

rzRRJ3kMc5NpKabw.description:
A ray that saps a foe's strength flashes from your hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If you succeed, that creature attempts a Fortitude save to determine the spell's effect. If your attack roll is a critical success, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

35i9N126q45J7qon.description:
You form a spiritual link with another creature, taking in its pain. When you Cast this Spell and at the start of each of your turns, if the target is below maximum Hit Points, it regains 2 Hit Points (or the difference between its current and maximum Hit Points, if that's lower). You lose as many Hit Points as the target regained.

This is a spiritual transfer, so no effects apply that would increase the Hit Points the target regains or decrease the Hit Points you lose. This transfer also ignores any temporary Hit Points you or the target have. Since this effect doesn't involve vitality or void energy, spirit link works even if you or the target is undead. While the duration persists, you gain no benefit from regeneration or fast healing. You can Dismiss this spell, and if you're ever at 0 Hit Points, spirit link ends automatically.

Heightened (+1) The number of Hit Points transferred each time increases by 2.
35i9N126q45J7qon.name: Spirit Link

6i4NLVpsMdAs6Yl7.description: You forge a temporary link between the target's life essence and your own. The target takes half damage from all effects that deal Hit Point damage, and you take the remainder of the damage. When you take damage through this link, you don't apply any resistances, weaknesses, or other abilities you have to that damage; you simply take that amount of damage. The spell ends if the target is ever more than 30 feet away from you. If either you or the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points, any damage from this spell is resolved and then the spell ends.
6i4NLVpsMdAs6Yl7.name: Shield Other

n1960SvW9XyzQmK6.description:
The rebel brute makes a single Strike with a two-handed melee weapon. If the rebel brute hits a target that is their size or smaller, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of the brute's turn, and the brute can automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.yNry1xMZqdWHncbV]{Shove: Athletics} it with the same benefits as the Shove action (including the critical success effect, if the Strike was a critical hit). If the brute moves to follow the target, that movement doesn't trigger reactions. This Strike has the following failure effect.

Failure The target becomes off-guard until the end of the elite rebel brute's current turn.

Reefclaw (PFS 1-12).description:
Reefclaws are aquatic monsters that resemble huge shrimp or lobsters. As one might expect from its name, a reefclaw's oversized claws are powerful weapons with their vicelike grip and the ability to inject potent venom into unfortunate prey.

While reefclaws can't speak, they are intelligent enough to understand the local language of humanoids near their hunting grounds. The creatures sometimes listen to conversations, either to gain intelligence on the best place to ambush aquatic or land-dwelling prey, or merely for entertainment value-reefclaws are particularly fond of listening to people with high-pitched voices. Reefclaws are usually solitary hunters, but small swarms of female reefclaws have been known to gather around a single male for mating purposes or together for the communal raising of their broods. In the latter case, the females will perform widespread hunts in order to bring back a large enough bounty to feed their young. Such hunting parties are extremely dangerous-they've been known to tip over small flshing boats and attack those who fall overboard.

Once a reefclaw has decided upon a course of action, it follows through even if doing so spells its own end. More than one reefclaw survivor has said that the creature released its bone-crushing grasp only after its brains were leaking from its broken skull, and even then the reefclaw was able to perform a terrible last slash as part of its dying breath. During mating season, female reefclaws are often a little more pragmatic and release their prey before endangering themselves and their offspring.

Despite their intelligence and the accompanying moral quandaries, reefclaws frequently find their way onto the dinner plates of land-dwelling hunters such as humans and hobgoblins. According to those who have a taste for reefclaw flesh, the meat is either delectably sweet or slightly tangy (in the case of warm-water reefclaws). Most civilized people who know of reefclaws' intellect find the act of eating them distasteful, but this does not dissuade unscrupulous nobles in coastal regions, for whom reefclaw meat is a delicacy well worth the expense. Likewise, fisherfolk whose focus is on the bottom line of their ledgers are more than willing to hunt the dangerous creatures-or, even better, hire out the task to naive adventurers.

Rending Hands.hazardReset: The underlying spirits remain, resetting the haunt every midnight, until the true story of what happened here becomes public.

Ruffian (Q11).description:
Using their strength to bully others into submission, ruffians often work as bodyguards and enforcers for powerful criminals like charlatans and fences.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

When the ruffian deals damage on a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and the ruffian can knock the target up to 10 feet away (this is forced movement).
1gLrx7OTMtRPbK9N.name: Brutal Beating

VQPPHF2M9xHf5XD3.description: The ruffian deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
VQPPHF2M9xHf5XD3.name: Sneak Attack

qy60SQR1jiyW4CXc.description:
Trigger The ruffian has one hand free, and its target is within reach of that hand.

Effect The ruffian makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If this Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the ruffian's next turn or until it leaves the ruffian's reach, whichever comes first.
qy60SQR1jiyW4CXc.name: Snagging Strike

Ruffian (Q11).name: Ruffian (Q11)

Scrabbling Hands.description: Illusory hands tear from the floorboards, clawing at their victim's legs and leaving real wounds.
Scrabbling Hands.hazardDisable: @Check[religion|dc:16|name:Exorcize the Spirits] (trained) to exorcize the spirits
Scrabbling Hands.hazardReset: The underlying spirits remain, resetting the haunt every midnight, until the true story of what happened here becomes public.
Scrabbling Hands.name: Scrabbling Hands

65AeZmM3u2IzHm8T.description: A sea devil invader's thrown weapons don't have their range increments halved when attacking from underwater or targeting an underwater creature.
65AeZmM3u2IzHm8T.name: Aquatic Throwing

DlDV8EP1r3cPEAQZ.description: The sea devil can communicate telepathically with sharks within range. It can communicate only simple concepts like "come," "guard," or "attack."
DlDV8EP1r3cPEAQZ.name: Shark Commune 150 feet

UitUHeToZkWVnSqi.description: When the sea devil deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals @Damage[1d4[bleed]] if the target was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} or if the attack was a critical hit.
UitUHeToZkWVnSqi.name: Bloodletting

wZI4VjpGf9shVUQq.description:
Requirements The sea devil is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The sea devil deals bleed damage to a living creature.

Effect The sea devil flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 11 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The sea devil can't voluntarily stop its frenzy. After its frenzy, the sea devil is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.
wZI4VjpGf9shVUQq.name: Blood Frenzy

HW7V7XrlfyvLiaDc.description:
An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. You deal electricity damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.
HW7V7XrlfyvLiaDc.name: Electric Arc

XRSN3ItI6JNDl6x0.description:
You call forth a powerful blast of pressurized water that bludgeons the target and knocks it back. Make a ranged spell attack roll.

Critical Success The target takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 10 feet.

Success The target takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 5 feet.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.
XRSN3ItI6JNDl6x0.name: Hydraulic Push

kQB2GVwdO4HzqefV.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
kQB2GVwdO4HzqefV.name: Dancing Lights

EVlaXMTgyim79QrT.description:
An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. You deal electricity damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.
EVlaXMTgyim79QrT.name: Electric Arc

JGHrGPWgANsIaE8t.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
JGHrGPWgANsIaE8t.name: Dancing Lights

znDf0aXHpBJIgxet.description:
You call forth a powerful blast of pressurized water that bludgeons the target and knocks it back. Make a ranged spell attack roll.

Critical Success The target takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 10 feet.

Success The target takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 5 feet.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.
znDf0aXHpBJIgxet.name: Hydraulic Push

Season's Toll (3-4).description: Arcs of primal energy emerge from the L-shaped stone wall at the center of each alcove.
Season's Toll (3-4).hazardDisable:
1 @Check[crafting|dc:25] or @Check[thievery|dc:25] (expert) to rig up a dummy or other object to distract one of the trap's sensors, or

1 @Check[nature|dc:23] (trained) to temporarily befuddle one of the sensors with knowledge of primal magic.

Alternatively, inserting the correct key into an alcove's keyhole disables that alcove's sensor.
Season's Toll (3-4).hazardReset: The trap is powered by the Eternal Bloom. It resets after 5 minutes, at which time the doors to the vault slam shut once again.
Season's Toll (3-4).hazardRoutine:
(4 actions) The trap loses one action per magical sensor disabled. On its initiative, the trap uses each of its actions to target one creature adjacent to or within an alcove with a negative effect that corresponds to the season opposite the one depicted on the alcove's murals (@Check[fortitude|dc:24] to resist). For the purposes of this trap, creatures who are within an alcove's landscape count are within that alcove. The trap can target only one creature per alcove per round.

Spring Alcove (death) The decay of late autumn takes hold of the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[2d6[void]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage and @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage. Effects that use vitality energy, such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell, automatically end this persistent damage.

Summer Alcove (cold) Winter's bitter chill descends on the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[2d6[cold]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[cold]] damage;and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour.

Autumn Alcove (poison) Poisonous springtime pollen sprays at the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Winter Alcove (fire) Heat greater than the hottest summer afternoon engulfs the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 hour.
Season's Toll (3-4).name: Season's Toll (3-4)

Season's Toll (5-6).description: Arcs of primal energy emerge from the L-shaped stone wall at the center of each alcove.
Season's Toll (5-6).hazardDisable:
@Check[crafting|dc:28] or @Check[thievery|dc:28] (expert) to rig up a dummy or other object to distract one of the trap's sensors, or @Check[nature|dc:26] (trained) to temporarily befuddle one of the sensors with knowledge of primal magic.

Alternatively, inserting the correct key into an alcove's keyhole disables that alcove's sensor.
Season's Toll (5-6).hazardReset: The trap is powered by the Eternal Bloom. It resets after 5 minutes, at which time the doors to the vault slam shut once again.
Season's Toll (5-6).hazardRoutine:
(4 actions) The trap loses one action per magical sensor disabled. On its initiative, the trap uses each of its actions to target one creature adjacent to or within an alcove with a negative effect that corresponds to the season opposite the one depicted on the alcove's murals (@Check[fortitude|dc:27] to resist). For the purposes of this trap, creatures who are within an alcove's landscape count are within that alcove. The trap can target only one creature per alcove per round.

Spring Alcove (death) The decay of late autumn takes hold of the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[(2d6+2)[void]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[void]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[void]] damage and @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage. Effects that use vitality energy, such as the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell, automatically end this persistent damage.

Summer Alcove (cold) Winter's bitter chill descends on the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[(2d6+2)[cold]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[cold]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[cold]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour.

Autumn Alcove (poison) Poisonous springtime pollen sprays at the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[(2d6+2)[poison]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[poison]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[poison]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Winter Alcove (fire) Heat greater than the hottest summer afternoon engulfs the target.

  • Critical Success The trap has no effect.
  • Success The target takes @Damage[(2d6+2)[fire]] damage.
  • Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[fire]] damage.
  • Critical Failure The target takes @Damage[(4d6+4)[fire]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 hour.

PsjwOHj53WzpVuM0.description:
Requirements The shadow wisp's previous action was a hit against an adjacent creature with its shadow tendril Strike.

Effect The shadow wisp @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps} into the creature's space and attempts an @Check[acrobatics|defense:reflex] check against the target's Reflex DC to attach itself to the target's shadow.

As long as it remains attached, it moves with the target and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to attacks from the target. The target can spend a move action on its turn to attempt a Reflex save against the wisp's Acrobatics DC to escape the shroud.
PsjwOHj53WzpVuM0.name: Shroud

UQLU4oGuKYLB11Xt.description:
Requirements The shadow wisp is attached to a living creature.

Effect The shadow wisp slips into the attached creature's shadow, dealing it @Damage[1d6[void]] damage. It can use the attached creature's shadow to make a shadow tendril Strike against another target up to 10 feet away
UQLU4oGuKYLB11Xt.name: Stretch Shadow

roVzfImlMLmqQTZT.description: An object shedding magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell) deals additional damage to the shadow wisp.
roVzfImlMLmqQTZT.name: Light Weakness

2ogoZzTpOLPjN7q6.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.
2ogoZzTpOLPjN7q6.name: Longsword

0shpSRAtDfm6i3Jk.description:
You create a reservoir of vitality from necromantic energy, gaining a number of temporary Hit Points equal to 6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+1) The temporary Hit Points increase by 3.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.PANUWN5xXC20WBg2]{Spell Effect: False Life}
0shpSRAtDfm6i3Jk.name: False Life

7feM9HFo6askioSA.description:
You channel void energy to harm the living or heal the undead. If the target is a living creature, you deal 1d8 void damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, you restore that amount of Hit Points. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing an undead creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.

3 (material, verbal, somatic) You disperse void energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the area.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.
7feM9HFo6askioSA.name: Harm

8GFtDhgiuoJBWdjW.description:
Siphoning void energy into yourself, your hand radiates a pale darkness. Your touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.

  • Living Creature The spell deals void damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round on a critical failure.
  • Undead Creature The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.

Heightened (+1) The void damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.
8GFtDhgiuoJBWdjW.name: Chill Touch

94PThSMzYGoFw70x.description: The skeletal mage can freely heighten the spells marked signature.
94PThSMzYGoFw70x.name: Signature Spell

EHTwhddlyIweS2bH.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.
EHTwhddlyIweS2bH.name: Shield

K1rcnncWjOawSXCY.description: When a skeletal mage casts a spell, either it gains temporary Hit Points equal to the spell's rank for 1 round, or one target takes @Damage[1[void]] damage per spell rank (if the spell already deals void damage, combine this with the spell's initial damage before determining weaknesses and resistances).
K1rcnncWjOawSXCY.name: Blood Magic

Lw4IkpTfxaR49pm5.description:
A cacophonous noise blasts out, dealing 2d10 sonic damage. Each creature must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is Deafened for 1 minute, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.
Lw4IkpTfxaR49pm5.name: Sound Burst

UIHDz2pCusyqKH8O.description:
The weapon glimmers with magic and energy. The target becomes a +1 striking weapon, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the number of weapon damage dice to two.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.GnWkI3T3LYRlm3X8]{Spell Effect: Runic Weapon}
UIHDz2pCusyqKH8O.name: Magic Weapon

dz2w8Pmr2bWDVQwr.description:
You fill the minds of your enemies with doubt.

Enemies in the area must succeed at a Will save or take a -1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area.

Once per turn, starting the turn after you cast bane, you can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet and force enemies in the area that weren't yet affected to attempt another saving throw.

Bane can counteract bless.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.UTLp7omqsiC36bso]{Spell Effect: Bane}
dz2w8Pmr2bWDVQwr.name: Bane

ehvB1ms6OaDOt4AC.description:
A ray that saps a foe's strength flashes from your hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If you succeed, that creature attempts a Fortitude save to determine the spell's effect. If your attack roll is a critical success, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Critical Failure The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}.
ehvB1ms6OaDOt4AC.name: Ray of Enfeeblement

gsVVrzAcVpAl9UbW.description: The skeleton mage causes the next spell they cast to affect a wider area. If the next action they use is to Cast a Spell that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and does not have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.
gsVVrzAcVpAl9UbW.name: Widen Spell

j4F86GUpk73iMlfW.description:
You shoot an utterly cold ray of darkness tinged with unholy energy. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. You deal 5d6 cold damage, plus 5d6 spirit damage if the target is a celestial.

If the ray passes through an area of magical light or targets a creature affected by magical light, chilling darkness attempts to counteract the light. If you need to determine whether the ray passes through an area of light, draw a line between yourself and the spell's target.

Critical Success The target takes double damage.

Success The target takes full damage.

Heightened (+1) The cold damage increases by 2d6, and the spirit damage against celestials increases by 2d6.
j4F86GUpk73iMlfW.name: Chilling Darkness

jrFAhh7Xh6T20pO0.description:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Heightened (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.
jrFAhh7Xh6T20pO0.name: Daze

tdJ9WkABmcruESwT.description:
You attack the target's life force with undeath, dealing 1d6 void damage. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage, and vitality effects heal it only half as much as normal for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, and vitality effects heal it only half as much as normal for 1 minute.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.
tdJ9WkABmcruESwT.name: Touch of Undeath

9kx4ldpmlvtr3m4m.description: The mount Strides twice, with its Speed increased by 10 feet.
9kx4ldpmlvtr3m4m.name: Gallop

JRbT9ykVW8Rkojc9.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save.
JRbT9ykVW8Rkojc9.name: Explosive Death

ohjbjl90iaap4rj2.description: Undead and creatures allied with them can Command a skeletal mount without needing to attempt a skill check.
ohjbjl90iaap4rj2.name: Undead Steed

7pgMKJH9axOeahR5.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[2d6[slashing]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save.
7pgMKJH9axOeahR5.name: Explosive Death

lHO6og3QnRNLXr60.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.
lHO6og3QnRNLXr60.name: Longsword

urpjbgyf46jcb1zm.description: The skeleton is covered in dripping blood and gains fast healing 1.
urpjbgyf46jcb1zm.name: Bloody

AZkt2c1pf6dJSG5l.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage @Check[reflex|dc:10|basic] save.
AZkt2c1pf6dJSG5l.name: Explosive Death

Smoldering Forest Fire.description: A fire engulfs a 10-foot-by-10-foot section of forest, then spreads on each of its turns.
Smoldering Forest Fire.hazardDisable:
A successful @Check[athletics|dc:13|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire], @Check[nature|dc:13|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire], or @Check[survival|dc:13|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire] check from an adjacent square is sufficient to smother one 5-foot-square of fire; each attempt is an Interact action. Dousing the flames automatically extinguishes one or more sections of fire, with no check. Water typically clears a 5-foot square if the amount is small (such as that from create water or hydraulic push). Larger amounts of water, such as a full bucket, typically douse a 10-foot-by-10-foot area (or 4 squares in some other shape). Throwing a bucket of water on flames requires an Interact action. A waterskin doesn't contain enough water to put out even 1 square of fire.

Cold can also put out fire, but only if the cold can affect an area; cold is usually less effective than water, so a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.EpxmUtLpCkE8R6KJ]{Frost Vial} typically puts out only 1 square of fire, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gYjPm7YwGtEa1oxh]{Ray of Frost} is ineffective.
Smoldering Forest Fire.hazardRoutine: On its turn, the fire spreads into a number of additional squares equal to half the number of squares the fire currently occupies, minimum 1 square. The GM determines the squares the fire spreads into. Any creature that ends its turn next to the flames takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, and any creature within the flames takes @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:13|basic|name:Smoldering Forest Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire] save for both). A creature can take damage from flames only once per round.
Smoldering Forest Fire.name: Smoldering Forest Fire

Sodden Floor.description: The floorboards here are rotting and soft, giving way and dropping anyone above into the hole below.
Sodden Floor.hazardDisable: @Check[crafting|dc:16|name:Reinforce Compromised Floorboards] (trained) to reinforce the compromised floorboards.
Sodden Floor.name: Sodden Floor

Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2).description: A wall socket loaded with a spear connects to a floor tile in one 5-foot square.
Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Disable Spear Launcher] (trained) on the floor tile or wall socket
Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2).name: Spear Launcher (Q9:1-2)

Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4).description: A wall socket loaded with a spear connects to a floor tile in one 5-foot square.
Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:22|name:Disable Spear Launcher] (trained) on the floor tile or wall socket
Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4).name: Spear Launcher (Q9:3-4)

Spiky Pit (1-2).description: A wooden trapdoor covers a pit that's 10 feet square and 20 feet deep.
Spiky Pit (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:12|name:Remove Trap Door|traits:mechanical,trap] to remove the trapdoor
Spiky Pit (1-2).hazardReset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.
Spiky Pit (1-2).name: Spiky Pit (1-2)

Spiky Pit (3-4).description: A wooden trapdoor covers a pit that's 10 feet square and 20 feet deep.
Spiky Pit (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:12|name:Remove Trap Door|traits:mechanical,trap] to remove the trapdoor
Spiky Pit (3-4).hazardReset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again.
Spiky Pit (3-4).name: Spiky Pit (3-4)

fubdZdYViakyxZv7.description:
Like normal objects, a spirit guardian statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 16.
fubdZdYViakyxZv7.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 6)

lIOY6nIok0PCCDbY.description:
Trigger A creature moves through the animated guardian statue's reach.

Effect The statue moves up to 20 feet in pursuit of the creature.
lIOY6nIok0PCCDbY.name: Follow Trespasser

Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).description:
Four techno-organic "bush" structures featuring mini-acid pumps activate. The first lashes out with sharp "branches" as it activates, and then all of the bushes spit acid at movement nearby.

HP is 10 per bush with a BT of 5
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] or @Check[engineering-lore|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) on each bush to collapse its acid pump into component parts (2 actions per bush).
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).hazardRoutine: (3 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each bush disabled. On each of the hazard's actions, one of the functional pumps spits acid at a creature within range. The bushes sense movement, only targeting creatures that moved from their space on their most recent turn. This trap does not attack any single creature more than once per round. It does not take a multiple attack penalty.
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6).name: Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (5-6)

Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).description:
Four techno-organic "bush"; structures featuring mini-acid pumps activate. The first lashes out with sharp "branches" as it activates, and then all of the bushes spit acid at movement nearby.

HP is 14 per bush with a BT of 7
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|traits:action:disable-a-device] or @Check[engineering-lore|dc:23|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) on each bush to collapse its acid pump into component parts (2 actions per bush).
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).hazardRoutine: (3 Actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each bush disabled. On each of the hazard's actions, one of the functional pumps spits acid at a creature within range. The bushes sense movement, and they only target creatures that moved from their space on their most recent turn. This trap does not attack any single creature more than once per round. It does not take a multiple attack penalty.
Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8).name: Spitting Acid 'Bushes' (7-8)

Squirrel Swarm (1-04).description: Swarms of centipedes are dangerous indeed, ravenous carpets of skittering hunger capable of devouring a traveler whole in a matter of minutes. Some alchemists submerge whole centipedes taken from swarms in their elixirs and some mutagens, claiming such infusions increase potency, though other say this is nothing more than quackish claptrap. Kobolds and mitflits are both known to incorporate swarms of centipedes into cunning traps, from simple pits filled with vermin or more complex affairs involving chutes that dump the vermin onto the heads of unwary intruders.

e6gQA5jXDMbCKyDj.description:
Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d4[piercing]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|traits:damaging-effect] save.

A creature affected by this attack can spend 2 actions on it's turn to attempt another @Check[reflex|dc:17] to remove the clumsy condition.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, is clumsy 2, and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
e6gQA5jXDMbCKyDj.name: Swarming Claws and Teeth

Squirrel Swarm (1-04).name: Squirrel Swarm (1-04)

7Rg3TQGFjt5uWzLw.description:
Like normal objects, the statue of Set has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 20.
7Rg3TQGFjt5uWzLw.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)

HeOOQ9BnUPuR38pL.description: The statue grinds a creature it has grabbed into the red-hot coals of its brazier. The target takes @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage and @Damage[1d8[persistent,fire]] damage
HeOOQ9BnUPuR38pL.name: Burn Alive

WPghLMZPRFiy5n4O.description:
The statue carries a wide brazier full of hot coals. To make flaming coal Strikes or use Burn Alive, the statue must have the brazier held in one hand or otherwise have it within reach.

Instead of targeting the statue with an attack, a creature can target the brazier directly. The brazier has the same AC and saves as the statue.

Dealing 15 cold damage to the brazier or dousing it with at least 2 gallons of water extinguishes the coals. This prevents the statue from using Burn Alive and causes its ranged attacks to no longer deal 2d8 fire damage.
WPghLMZPRFiy5n4O.name: Brazier

Steaming Fields (5-6).description: A field of warm mist covers an open plain. Pockets of highly pressurized steam lie @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} in the earth; pressure releases jets of steam.
Steaming Fields (5-6).hazardDisable: @Check[survival|dc:26] (expert) twice to navigate a safe path
Steaming Fields (5-6).name: Steaming Fields (5-6)

Steaming Fields (7-8).description: A field of warm mist covers an open plain. Pockets of highly pressurized steam lie @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} in the earth; pressure releases jets of steam.
Steaming Fields (7-8).hazardDisable: @Check[survival|dc:30] (expert) twice to navigate a safe path
Steaming Fields (7-8).name: Steaming Fields (7-8)

OsQYZ3d2z3Nck2Lr.description:
Bolstered by magical power, the target grows to size Large. Its equipment grows with it but returns to natural size if removed. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}. Its reach increases by 5 feet (or by 10 feet if it started out Tiny), and it gains a +2 status bonus to melee damage. This spell has no effect on a Large or larger creature.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.sPCWrhUHqlbGhYSD]{Spell Effect: Enlarge}

Heightened (4th) The creature instead grows to size Huge. The status bonus to melee damage is +4 and the creature's reach increases by 10 feet (or 15 feet if the creature started out Tiny). The spell has no effect on a Huge or larger creature.

Heightened (6th) Choose either the 2nd-rank or 4th-rank version of this spell and apply its effects to up to 10 willing creatures.
OsQYZ3d2z3Nck2Lr.name: Enlarge (Self Only)

uPnsrKVcNbXGLCF7.description:
You merge with an adjacent block of stone with enough volume to fit you and your worn and held possessions. You must touch the stone when you Cast the Spell. You can hear, but not see, what's going on outside the stone, and you can cast spells while in the stone as long as they don't require line of effect beyond the stone.

Significant physical damage to the stone while you are inside it expels you and deals 10d6 damage to you. Passwall expels you without dealing damage and ends one with stone. You can Dismiss this spell.
uPnsrKVcNbXGLCF7.name: Meld into Stone

vMkxtoPd5hKfpXvp.description: The steel mephit breathes shards of iron in a @Template[cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[2d4[slashing]] damage to each creature within the area (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save). Creatures who fail their save against this effect also take @Damage[1d6[bleed]]. The steel mephit can't use its breath weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge breath weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.
vMkxtoPd5hKfpXvp.name: Breath Weapon

DGIe8y52OV9orOUE.description:
Trigger The storm acolyte critically hits with a scimitar Strike

Effect The storm acolyte releases a blast of lighting in a @Template[burst|distance:10] centered on the target. A creature in the area other than the storm acolyte takes @Damage[1d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:13|basic] save). On a critical failure, such a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.
DGIe8y52OV9orOUE.name: Storm Smite

uFCg2NrXVFb9lKms.description:
Trigger The storm warrior-priest critically hits with a scimitar Strike

Effect The storm warrior-priest releases a blast of lighting in a @Template[burst|distance:10] centered on the target. A creature in the area other than the storm warrior-priest takes @Damage[2d6[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic] save). On a critical failure, such a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 round.
uFCg2NrXVFb9lKms.name: Storm Smite

Submerged Shard.description: An immense, jagged piece of clear crystal 10 feet square and forty feet high juts up from the seafloor
Submerged Shard.hazardDisable: @Check[survival|dc:13|name:Blunt Crystal] (trained) to blunt the crystal's edges without getting cut
Submerged Shard.hazardReset: The hazard still damages any creature or object that enters its space, but the surface doesn't become hidden again until it settles over the course of 1 minute.
Submerged Shard.name: Submerged Shard

Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).description: A cloud of invisible magical sensors covers four squares on the map. One of these hazards is in the squares directly above each of the four yellow runes on the map, and the other is in the squares directly above each of the four blue runes on the map.
Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).hazardDisable: @Check[acrobatics|dc:15] to approach without triggering the trap followed by @Check[thievery|dc:17] (trained) to erase the rune, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (1st level; counteract DC 15) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).hazardReset: The trap resets each day at dawn.
Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11).name: Summoning Rune (PFS 1-11)

1ss5qypuju7sem9o.description: Synthetic Khismar makes two storm-fist Strikes against a single target. If either of the attacks deals damage, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of Synthetic Khismar's next turn. His multiple attack penalty increases after making both attacks.
1ss5qypuju7sem9o.name: Programmed Combo

35j0ecc24cmv4xws.description:
Frequency once per turn

Range 100 feet

Effect Synthetic Khismar chooses the target of one technological construct or hazard; if this would cause the technological construct or hazard to attack a creature it would not normally attack, it takes a -2 circumstance penalty to its attack rolls and DCs against that creature.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.2ccLQxmTlTPySnOR]{Effect: Technology Control}
35j0ecc24cmv4xws.name: Technology Control

5ib8kbfq4mi5nvjt.description:
Trigger Synthetic Khismar takes electricity damage

Effect Synthetic Khismar gains resistance 20 to electricity against the triggering attack and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for [[/br 1d4 #Quickened Duration]]{1d4 rounds}.
5ib8kbfq4mi5nvjt.name: Overcharge

WurEoe85dRK7mHti.description:
As you invest these embroidered strips of cloth, you must meditate and slowly wrap them around your hands. These handwraps have weapon runes etched into them to give your unarmed attacks the benefits of those runes, making your unarmed attacks work like magic weapons. For example, +1 striking handwraps of mighty blows would give you a +1 item bonus to attack rolls with your unarmed attacks and increase the damage of your unarmed attacks from one weapon die to two (normally 2d4 instead of 1d4, but if your fists have a different weapon damage die or you have other unarmed attacks, use two of that die size instead).

You can upgrade, add, and transfer runes to and from the handwraps just as you would for a weapon, and you can attach talismans to the handwraps. Treat the handwraps as melee weapons of the brawling group with light Bulk for these purposes. Property runes apply only when they would be applicable to the unarmed attack you're using. For example, a property that must be applied to a slashing weapon wouldn't function when you attacked with a fist, but you would gain its benefits if you attacked with a claw or some other slashing unarmed attack.
WurEoe85dRK7mHti.name: +1 Handwraps of Mighty Blows

f0pgwkudf2q8lg8n.description:
Requirements Synthetic Khismar has 20 HP or fewer

Effect Synthetic Khismar explodes in a ball of burning plasma, destroying himself completely and dealing @Damage[8d6[electricity]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic])

Special Synthetic Khismar automatically activates this ability as a free action when brought to 0 Hit Points.
f0pgwkudf2q8lg8n.name: Self-Destruct

p93B403kaFXarJf0.description: Like normal objects, Synthetic Khismar has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage he takes by an amount equal to his Hardness. Once Synthetic Khismar is reduced to fewer than half his Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, his construct armor breaks and his AC is reduced to 20.
p93B403kaFXarJf0.name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)

7gJE0E093kut3vOe.description: Synthetic Khismar makes two storm-fist Strikes against a single target. His multiple attack penalty increases after making both attacks.
7gJE0E093kut3vOe.name: Programmed Combo

Requirements Synthetic Khismar has 20 HP or fewer

plKKjJqfaK7sTlfD.description:
Trigger Synthetic Khismar takes electricity damage

plKKjJqfaK7sTlfD.name: Overcharge

Vikh67yTYfnlkcIk.description:
Trigger The technic zombie critically hits a creature with a fist Strike

Effect The Technic zombie releases a jolt of electricity through its fist, dealing @Damage[1d8[electricity]] damage to the target. Additionally, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 round (@Check[reflex|dc:15|traits:damaging-effect] negates)

Frequency once per minute
Vikh67yTYfnlkcIk.name: Voltaic Surge

Vikh67yTYfnlkcIk.description:
Trigger The technic zombie critically hits a creature with a fist Strike

Effect The Technic zombie releases a jolt of electricity through its fist, dealing @Damage[2d6[electricity]] damage to the target. Additionally, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 round (@Check[reflex|dc:18|traits:damaging-effect] negates)

Frequency once per minute
Vikh67yTYfnlkcIk.name: Voltaic Surge

Amvw7x9z5fAeJSBT.description: The ascendant beats their wings in a frenzied motion, creating a powerful blast of wind that disperses fog and gases and blows objects of light Bulk or less away. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} of the ascendant must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:24] save or be pushed 5 feet away from the ascendant, or 10 feet on a critical failure. A flying creature that fails its save gets a critical failure instead.
Amvw7x9z5fAeJSBT.name: Furious Wings

QdemKlqmVgeu8M9V.description:
Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you-even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container-the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.
QdemKlqmVgeu8M9V.name: Dimension Door (At Will)

XqocduBIVhrD8vu2.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).
XqocduBIVhrD8vu2.name: True Seeing (Constant)

jas8bT1w5xGIzMab.description: Any weapon the ascendant holds gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} rune while they hold it.
jas8bT1w5xGIzMab.name: Covetous Flames

sDi7DbArgkHn3N47.description:
The target makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing it using hearing or other senses alone. The target can't use sonic attacks, nor can it use actions with the auditory trait. This prevents it from casting spells that include verbal components.

Heightened (4th) The spell effect emanates from the touched creature, silencing all sound in or passing through a 10- foot radius and preventing any auditory and sonic effects in the affected area. While within the radius, creatures are subject to the same effects as the target. Depending upon the position of the effect, a creature might notice the lack of sound reaching it (blocking off the noise coming from a party, for example).
sDi7DbArgkHn3N47.name: Silence

7RYfL3pdW794bMch.description: Any weapon the ascendant holds gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XszNvxnymWYRaoTp]{Flaming} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} rune while they hold it.
7RYfL3pdW794bMch.name: Covetous Flames

RhDyd8lg9pcG8h7R.description:
The target makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing it using hearing or other senses alone. The target can't use sonic attacks, nor can it use actions with the auditory trait. This prevents it from casting spells that include verbal components.

kjQQ3kAGSMzFHLmO.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).
kjQQ3kAGSMzFHLmO.name: True Seeing (Constant)

GuFdSjxJc9byaA8I.description:
The thorned cocoon relays Qxal's telepathic coercions in either a @Template[line|distance:30] or a @Template[cone|distance:15]. Each creature in the emanation must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Hypnotic Thrum, it becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}. For as long as it is fascinated, it must spend each of its actions to move closer to the thorned cocoon as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If the creature is adjacent to the thorned cocoon, it stays still and doesn't act.

Critical Failure As failure, but the condition doesn't end automatically. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the fascinated condition ends.
GuFdSjxJc9byaA8I.name: Hypnotic Thrum

IPzJCY6pFm1DzEQH.description: The cocoon unravels as it envelops a Small, Medium, or Large humanoid creature that's unconscious, willing, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by Hypnotic Thrum, and that is within reach of the cocoon's tendrils, moving into the creature's space as part of this action. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} and take @Damage[1d12[mental],1d12[slashing]]{1d12 mental damage and 1d12 slashing damage} (double damage on a critical failure). Feeding on a creature's Thoughts doesn't end fascination caused by Hypnotic Thrum.
IPzJCY6pFm1DzEQH.name: Feed on Thoughts

GuFdSjxJc9byaA8I.description:

KIM4GGcs2YWfve43.description:
The mountain goat Strides up to double its Speed in a straight line and then makes a horn attack.

If the mountain goat moved at least 20 feet, its Push increases to 10 feet on a hit.
KIM4GGcs2YWfve43.name: Powerful Charge

7bYmvKguXrauVUZF.description: The first creature hit by a snapjaw is affected by the Pesticide poison.
7bYmvKguXrauVUZF.name: Jaws

9cGD3zBhLj62TFxN.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:17]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d4[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)
9cGD3zBhLj62TFxN.name: Pesticide

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d12[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[2d8[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)
B8mvt1ZNTGEoWCSs.name: Pesticide

Q1jpgRADuCNRPlv4.description: The first creature hit by a snapjaw is affected by the Pesticide poison.
Q1jpgRADuCNRPlv4.name: Jaws

Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2).description: Pressure sensitive panels in the floor connect to a barrel of debris hidden in the hallway's ceiling
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|name:Disable Floor Panels|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) on the floor panels before the barrel falls
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2).name: Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (1-2)

Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4).description: Pressure sensitive panels in the floor connect to a barrel of debris hidden in the hallway's ceiling
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4).hazardDisable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|name:Disable Floor Panels|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) on the floor panels before the barrel falls
Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4).name: Trapmaster Tok's Surprise (3-4)

Treacherous Quagmire.description: A patch of treacherous bog attempts to submerge creatures that step onto it.
Treacherous Quagmire.hazardDisable: @Check[survival|dc:18|name:Disturb Surface|traits:secret,action:sense-direction,exploration] (trained) to disturb the surface and make the quagmire plainly visible.
Treacherous Quagmire.hazardReset: The hazard still submerges anyone who walks in, but the surface doesn't become hidden again until it settles over the course of 24 hours
Treacherous Quagmire.hazardRoutine:
(1 action) On its initiative, the quagmire pulls each creature within it 1 square toward the center of the quagmire and 1 step further submerged; a creature that is submerged up to its waist becomes submerged up to its neck, and a creature that is submerged up to its neck is pulled under and has to hold its breath to avoid suffocation.

A creature in the quagmire can attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Swim Out of Quagmire|traits:environmental,hazard,action:swim] check to Swim to either raise itself by 1 step if its submerged to its neck or worse, or to swim out of the quagmire if its submerged up to only its waist. On a critical failure, the creature is pulled down 1 step. A creature that Swims out of the quagmire escapes the hazard and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} adjacent to the quagmire. Other creatures can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} the creature, typically by using a rope or similar tool, or attempt to pull a creature within their reach out with a @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Pull Out of Quagmire|traits:environmental,hazard,action:aid] check, with the same results as if the creature attempted the check.
Treacherous Quagmire.name: Treacherous Quagmire

Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01).description:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.
TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.name: Slow

lVjydvACaQe5413Q.description: A zombie hulk can throw corpses at foes. While any Medium dead body will do, they sometimes throw @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.0plBflWwrCWQO2RO]{Zombie Shamblers}, who take just as much damage from being thrown as the target they hit. A thrown shambler lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, but if it's not destroyed, it can rise and use other actions normally.
lVjydvACaQe5413Q.name: Corpse Throwing

oGTXq7oHJ3qW09Pk.description: The zombie hulk makes a hunk of meat Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the Strike's reach. This attack counts as two attacks for the zombie hulk's multiple attack penalty.
oGTXq7oHJ3qW09Pk.name: Wide Swing

Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01).name: Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-01)

Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13).description:
Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

TtcFIJZjrZ4Vaaml.name: Slow

Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13).name: Unkillable Zombie Brute (PFS 1-13)

5WvfWVJiUmaI6JDN.description:
An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. You deal electricity damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.
5WvfWVJiUmaI6JDN.name: Electric Arc

PgG4XvZ7HgZ8JGVJ.description: Plants of supernatural significance provide a primal focus for primal spellcasters, such as druids, when using certain abilities and casting some spells. A bundle of holly and mistletoe must be held in one hand to use it. Other primal foci exist for druids focused on other aspects of nature.
PgG4XvZ7HgZ8JGVJ.name: Holly and Mistletoe

SflYlBvdk3oHOdvW.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangling Flora}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.
SflYlBvdk3oHOdvW.name: Scroll of Entangle (Level 2)

TYEhkI6SxmJ97AsE.description:
A vine covered in sticky sap appears from thin air, flicking from your hand and lashing itself to the target. Attempt a spell attack against the target.

Critical Success The target gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition and takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition.

Success The target takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.TwtUIEyenrtAbeiX]{Spell Effect: Tangle Vine}

Failure The target is unaffected.

Heightened (2nd) The effects last for 2 rounds.

Heightened (4th) The effects last for 1 minute.
TYEhkI6SxmJ97AsE.name: Tanglefoot

Ufgd9Y89ScN3I9Do.description: Vengeant Thorn has an innate connection to storms. He does not take circumstance penalties to ranged spell attacks or Perception checks caused by weather, and his targeted spells ignore concealment caused by weather (such as fog).
Ufgd9Y89ScN3I9Do.name: Storm Born

aK1WKmlsUZKo9yUq.description:
You call forth a powerful blast of pressurized water that bludgeons the target and knocks it back. Make a ranged spell attack roll.

Critical Success The target takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 10 feet.

Success The target takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 5 feet.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.
aK1WKmlsUZKo9yUq.name: Hydraulic Push

g7lDgJySBVPuXRVL.description:
In your mind's eye, you see a path northward. You immediately know which direction is north (if it exists at your current location).

Heightened (7th) You can instead know the direction to a familiar location, such as a previous home or a favorite tavern.
g7lDgJySBVPuXRVL.name: Know Direction

nKNQd9T92uZTt5pT.description:
You surround a foe in a swirling storm of violent winds, roiling clouds, and crackling lightning. The storm deals 1d12 electricity damage. The target must attempt a basic Reflex save. On a failure, the target also is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 round and takes @Damage[1[persistent,electricity]] damage.

Heightened (+1) The initial damage increases by 1d12, and the persistent electricity damage on a failure increases by 1.
nKNQd9T92uZTt5pT.name: Tempest Surge

xgFlPi76nAG3IOGC.description:
You obscure the tracks you leave behind and make it harder for others to find you. The DC of checks to Track you gains a +4 status bonus or is equal to your spell DC, whichever results in a higher DC. You can benefit from only one pass without trace spell at a time.

Heightened (2nd) The duration increases to 8 hours.

Heightened (4th) The duration increases to 8 hours. The spell has a range of 20 feet and an area of a 20-foot-emanation, affecting up to 10 creatures of your choice within that area.
xgFlPi76nAG3IOGC.name: Pass Without Trace

6sysP28OK5HAOmr1.description:
In your mind's eye, you see a path northward. You immediately know which direction is north (if it exists at your current location).

Heightened (7th) You can instead know the direction to a familiar location, such as a previous home or a favorite tavern.
6sysP28OK5HAOmr1.name: Know Direction

Heightened (+1) The initial damage increases by 1d12, and the persistent electricity damage on a failure increases by 1.
8Wn8aQrgIW5h7hRp.name: Tempest Surge

Critical Success The target takes 6d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 10 feet.

Success The target takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 5 feet.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.
QeDqggvt2PKkihUh.name: Hydraulic Push

TdNbVnlNbCKhpwRO.description:
The target's skin becomes covered in bark. The target gains resistance 2 to bludgeoning and piercing damage and weakness 3 to fire. After the target takes fire damage, it can Dismiss the spell as a free action triggered by taking the damage; doing so doesn't reduce the fire damage the target was dealt.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.HoOujAdQWCN4E6sQ]{Spell Effect: Oaken Resilience}

Heightened (+2) The resistances increase by 2, and the weakness increases by 3.
TdNbVnlNbCKhpwRO.name: Barkskin

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA]{Entangling Flora}

Casting a Spell from a scroll requires holding the scroll in one hand and activating it with a Cast a Spell activity using the normal number of actions for that spell.

To Cast a Spell from a scroll, the spell must appear on your spell list. Because you're the one Casting the Spell, use your spell attack roll and spell DC. The spell also gains the appropriate trait for your tradition (arcane, divine, occult, or primal).

Any physical material components and costs are provided when a scroll is created, so you don't need to provide them when Casting a Spell from a scroll. You must replace any required material component for that spell with a somatic component. If the spell requires a focus, you must have that focus to Cast the Spell from a scroll.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

Heightened (2nd) The duration increases to 8 hours.

uWliJdp3XC2hwvGB.name: Obscuring Mist

An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. You deal electricity damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

A bundle of holly and mistletoe must be held in one hand to use it. Other primal foci exist for druids focused on other aspects of nature.
v7i9xwtvMkuxZfpg.name: Holly and Mistletoe

xnfoHwBp6vUVC94V.name: Storm Born

Vengeful Spirits.description: A cadre of evil spirits assails people's minds throughout the stretch of forest. The spirits first afflict their hosts with visceral images of their own deaths, then try to recreate their deaths by forcing their hosts to inflict similar wounds upon themselves. Creatures frightened by the haunt appear to have ephemeral masks with horns, tusks, and yellow eyes over their faces.
Vengeful Spirits.hazardDisable: Two @Check[occultism|dc:26|name:Exorcise the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] or @Check[religion|dc:26|name:Exorcise the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] (trained) to exorcise the spirits. A creature can either inflict 4 mental damage to the haunt or permanently lower the DC of checks to exorcise the spirits 1 by succeeding at a @Check[diplomacy|dc:22|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to calm the spirits, a @Check[nature|dc:22|name:Ward Against the Spirits|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to use kami-specific warding incantations, a @Check[occultism|dc:20|name:Leverage Haunt Lore|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to leverage obscure haunt lore, or a @Check[religion|dc:22|name:Lesser Exorcism to Weaken the Haunt|traits:hazard,haunt,complex] check to use a lesser exorcism. Any creature currently frightened by the haunt is a potential target for inflicting damage to the haunt; mental and vitality damage only affect such a host creature if they choose to be affected, while force or similar damage harms both the haunt and the host equally.
Vengeful Spirits.hazardRoutine:
(3 actions) On its initiative, the haunt uses its first two actions to attempt to terrify a random target in its area that is not already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22|name:Resist Terror|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to this haunt for 24 hours.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is frightened 1. The value of the frightened condition does not automatically decrease by 1 at the end of each of the target's turns. Instead, the target can attempt a @Check[will|dc:18|name:Reduce Frightened|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save at the end of each of their turns to lower their frightened value by 1.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. The value of the frightened condition does not automatically decrease by 1 at the end of each of the target's turns. Instead, the target can attempt a @Check[will|dc:18|name:Reduce Frightened|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save at the end of each of their turns to lower their frightened value by 1.

The haunt then spends an action to compels one of the creatures that it has frightened to harm itself with surrounding forest debris, its strength fueled by spirit possession. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22|name:Resist Attacking Yourself|traits:emotion,fear,mental,hazard,haunt] save or attempt to Strike itself during its turn as its first action, using the haunt's statistics below. Note that frightened applies equally to the creature's attack roll and AC, and therefore does not affect the accuracy of the attack.
Vengeful Spirits.name: Vengeful Spirits

0tGnZaR9bRIg4mmb.description: This large battle axe is too heavy to wield with only one hand. Many greataxes incorporate two blades, and they are often "bearded", having a hook at the bottom to increase the strength of their chopping power.
0tGnZaR9bRIg4mmb.name: Greataxe

3yiWnndSEksZGk9A.description: The guard captain makes a single melee Strike and compares the attack roll result to the ACs of up to two foes, each of whom must be within the guard captain's melee reach and adjacent to the other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature the guard captain hits. A swipe counts as two attacks for the multiple attack penalty. The modifier of a weapon with a sweep trait applies to all attacks.
3yiWnndSEksZGk9A.name: Swipe

DIEeDlqO1PnlxtrJ.description: Half plate consists of most of the upper body plates used in full plate, with lighter or sparser steel plate protection for the arms and legs. This provides some of the protection of full plate with greater flexibility and speed. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor and a pair of gauntlets.
DIEeDlqO1PnlxtrJ.name: Half Plate

bA9Zr8RQKS3Z204N.description:
The guard captain makes a melee Strike.

This counts as two attacks when calculating the multiple attack penalty. If this Strike hits, it deals an extra a die of weapon damage.
bA9Zr8RQKS3Z204N.name: Power Attack

hkcHI1qrNwpGdZit.description: The guard captain Strides twice. If the guard captain ends their movement within a melee reach of at least one enemy, they can make a melee Strike against that enemy.
hkcHI1qrNwpGdZit.name: Sudden Charge

eZYM8XOsF2fEcZAn.description: The vicious vulpine Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. If the fox begins this action hidden, it remains hidden until after this ability's Strike.
eZYM8XOsF2fEcZAn.name: Pounce

gs0ejzDUvdjSj1ad.description: A vicious vulpine deals 1d4 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
gs0ejzDUvdjSj1ad.name: Sneak Attack

0viXaN1VbbHTmKVH.description: The guard makes a Strike with a melee weapon, extending their reach by 5 feet for that Strike. If the weapon has the disarm, shove, or trip trait, the guard can use the corresponding action instead of a Strike.
0viXaN1VbbHTmKVH.name: Lunge

BiTe8WL5VRE2ikWS.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.
BiTe8WL5VRE2ikWS.name: Longsword

3SBu5uViF2n65dfu.description: A creature hit by the voidworm's tail Strike is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical hit). A successful @Check[will|dc:22] save negates this effect and grants temporary immunity to confounding lash for 1 minute.
3SBu5uViF2n65dfu.name: Confounding Lash

6swUifpiN0jMPHmF.description: You repel effects that would hinder a creature or slow its movement. While under this spell's effect, the target ignores effects that would give them a circumstance penalty to Speed. When they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} an effect that has them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, they automatically succeed unless the effect is magical and of a higher level than the freedom of movement spell.
6swUifpiN0jMPHmF.name: Freedom of Movement (Constant)

8n3RTLIdXCvuvkZU.description: The target's form appears blurry. It becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}. As the nature of this effect still leaves the target's location obvious, the target can't use this concealment to Hide or Sneak.
8n3RTLIdXCvuvkZU.name: Blur (Self Only)

PLPKdmnt6YIHpbHr.description: In any round the voidworm ouroboros has less than half its total Hit Points, it can split into two standard @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.8meqlz36gPHTTvNz]{Voidworms} which assume normal statistics for that creature.
PLPKdmnt6YIHpbHr.name: Divide

Qfkh85XuHvAlt1Su.description: A voidworm can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Veil of Privacy} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.
Qfkh85XuHvAlt1Su.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet

Z1GpEdQSizMCFohO.description:
The voidworm takes on the appearance of a Tiny animal. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Z1GpEdQSizMCFohO.name: Change Shape

mZVrJ0cOr8c0ciHM.description:
Your eyes glow as you sense aligned auras. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. You detect auras of that alignment. You receive no information beyond presence or absence. You can choose not to detect creatures or effects you're aware have that alignment.

Only creatures of 6th level or higher-unless divine spellcasters, undead, or beings from the Outer Sphere-have alignment auras.

Heightened (2nd) You learn each aura's location and strength.
mZVrJ0cOr8c0ciHM.name: Detect Alignment (Lawful Only)(At Will)

oxY72lUlDZ1DPZJU.description:
A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the protean takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The protean is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the protean automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}
oxY72lUlDZ1DPZJU.name: Protean Anatomy

po26JcPcg2sZph8R.description: You call forth a cloud of mist. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become Concealed to creatures within it. You can Dismiss the cloud.
po26JcPcg2sZph8R.name: Obscuring Mist

qNoemSXZZUZL4IMI.description:
The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the Spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of four options.

  • Cook Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
  • Lift Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
